title: Mlflow tracking server error when exploring artifacts

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for information on what types of issues we address.

**Please fill in this installation issue template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:

Mac OS 10.14
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:
source installation
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:
mlflow 1.9.1
- **Python version**:
python 3.8.3
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem
Using an ftp server for artifact store and making a successful run and logging it with log_model, the model gets correctly stored on the ftp server. Exploring it via the interface however crashes when clicking the folder for the model. Going inside the container the model is correctly stored. 

### Other info / logs
mlflow server -p 8000 -h 0.0.0.0 --backend-store-uri postgresql://xx:xx@postgres/mlflow_db --default-artifact-root ftp://xx:xx@ftpserver/home/mlflow
is the command for the mlflow tracking server docker container called training

`
mlflow.tracking.set_tracking_uri("http://training:8000")
`
`
with mlflow.start_run(run_name="experiment_name"):
`
`
    mlflow.log_metric("1", 1)
`
`
    mlflow.pyfunc.log_model("", python_model=a)
`
`
